org.gradoop.temporal.model.api

Interface TemporalGraphOperators

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BaseGraphOperators<TemporalGraphHead,TemporalVertex,TemporalEdge,TemporalGraph,TemporalGraphCollection>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TemporalGraph

    public interface TemporalGraphOperators
extends BaseGraphOperators<TemporalGraphHead,TemporalVertex,TemporalEdge,TemporalGraph,TemporalGraphCollection>
    Defines the operators that are available on a TemporalGraph.

    • Method Detail

      • snapshot

        default TemporalGraph snapshot(TemporalPredicate predicate)
        Extracts a snapshot of this temporal graph using a given temporal predicate. The predicate is applied on the valid time dimension by default. To use the transaction time dimension, use snapshot(TemporalPredicate, TimeDimension) instead. This operator will calculate the subgraph induced by the predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the temporal predicate to apply on the valid times
        Returns:
        the snapshot as a temporal graph

      • snapshot

        default TemporalGraph snapshot(TemporalPredicate predicate,
                               TimeDimension dimension)
        Extracts a snapshot of this temporal graph using a given temporal predicate. The predicate is applied on the given time dimension. This operator will calculate the subgraph induced by the predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - the temporal predicate to apply
        dimension - the dimension that is used
        Returns:
        the snapshot as a temporal graph

      • diff

        default TemporalGraph diff(TemporalPredicate firstSnapshot,
                           TemporalPredicate secondSnapshot)
        Compares two snapshots of this graph. Given two temporal predicates, this operation will check if a graph element (vertex or edge) was added, removed or persists in the second snapshot compared to the first snapshot. The predicates are applied on the valid times. To use transaction time dimension, use diff(TemporalPredicate, TemporalPredicate, TimeDimension).

        This operation returns the union of both snapshots with the following changes: A property with key will be set on each graph element. Its value will be set to

        • 0, if the element is present in both snapshots.
        • 1, if the element is present in the second, but not the first snapshot (i.e. it was added since the first snapshot).
        • -1, if the element is present in the first, but not the second snapshot (i.e. it was removed since the first snapshot).
        Graph elements present in neither snapshot will be discarded. The resulting graph will not be verified, i.e. dangling edges could occur. Use the verify() operator to validate the graph. The graph head is preserved.
        Parameters:
        firstSnapshot - The predicate used to determine the first snapshot.
        secondSnapshot - The predicate used to determine the second snapshot.
        Returns:
        A temporal graph containing the union of vertex and edge sets of both snapshots, defined by the given two predicate functions. A property with key Diff.PROPERTY_KEY is set on each graph element with a numerical value (-1, 0, 1) defined above.

      • diff

        default TemporalGraph diff(TemporalPredicate firstSnapshot,
                           TemporalPredicate secondSnapshot,
                           TimeDimension dimension)
        Compares two snapshots of this graph. Given two temporal predicates, this operation will check if a graph element (vertex or edge) was added, removed or persists in the second snapshot compared to the first snapshot. The predicates are applied on the specified time dimension.

        This operation returns the union of both snapshots with the following changes: A property with key will be set on each graph element. Its value will be set to

        • 0, if the element is present in both snapshots.
        • 1, if the element is present in the second, but not the first snapshot (i.e. it was added since the first snapshot).
        • -1, if the element is present in the first, but not the second snapshot (i.e. it was removed since the first snapshot).
        Graph elements present in neither snapshot will be discarded. The resulting graph will not be verified, i.e. dangling edges could occur. Use the verify() operator to validate the graph. The graph head is preserved.
        Parameters:
        firstSnapshot - The predicate used to determine the first snapshot.
        secondSnapshot - The predicate used to determine the second snapshot.
        dimension - The time dimension that will be considered by the predicates.
        Returns:
        A temporal graph containing the union of vertex and edge sets of both snapshots, defined by the given two predicate functions. A property with key Diff.PROPERTY_KEY is set on each graph element with a numerical value (-1, 0, 1) defined above.

      • temporalQuery

        default TemporalGraphCollection temporalQuery(String temporalGdlQuery)
        Evaluates the given query using the Temporal-GDL query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.

        Note, that this method used no statistics about the data graph which may result in bad runtime performance. Use temporalQuery(String, TemporalGraphStatistics) to provide statistics for the query planner.

        Parameters:
        temporalGdlQuery - A Temporal-GDL query as String
        Returns:
        graph collection containing matching subgraphs

      • temporalQuery

        default TemporalGraphCollection temporalQuery(String temporalGdlQuery,
                                              String constructionPattern)
        Evaluates the given query using the Temporal-GDL query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.

        Note, that this method used no statistics about the data graph which may result in bad runtime performance. Use temporalQuery(String, String, TemporalGraphStatistics) to provide statistics for the query planner.

        In addition, the operator can be supplied with a construction pattern allowing the creation of new graph elements based on variable bindings of the match pattern. Consider the following example:
        graph.query( "MATCH (a:Author)-[:WROTE]->(:Paper)<-[:WROTE]-(b:Author) WHERE a <> b", "(a)-[:CO_AUTHOR]->(b)")

        The query pattern is looking for pairs of authors that worked on the same paper. The construction pattern defines a new edge of type CO_AUTHOR between the two entities.

        Parameters:
        temporalGdlQuery - A Temporal-GDL query as String
        constructionPattern - Construction pattern in Temporal-GDL format
        Returns:
        graph collection containing the output of the construct pattern

      • temporalQuery

        default TemporalGraphCollection temporalQuery(String temporalGdlQuery,
                                              TemporalGraphStatistics graphStatistics)
        Evaluates the given query using the Temporal-GDL query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.
        Parameters:
        temporalGdlQuery - A Temporal-GDL query as String
        graphStatistics - statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing matching subgraphs

      • temporalQuery

        default TemporalGraphCollection temporalQuery(String temporalGdlQuery,
                                              String constructionPattern,
                                              TemporalGraphStatistics graphStatistics)
        Evaluates the given query using the Temporal-GDL query engine. The engine uses default morphism strategies, which is vertex homomorphism and edge isomorphism. The vertex and edge data of the data graph elements is attached to the resulting vertices.

        In addition, the operator can be supplied with a construction pattern allowing the creation of new graph elements based on variable bindings of the match pattern. Consider the following example:
        graph.query( "MATCH (a:Author)-[:WROTE]->(:Paper)<-[:WROTE]-(b:Author) WHERE a <> b", "(a)-[:CO_AUTHOR]->(b)")

        The query pattern is looking for pairs of authors that worked on the same paper. The construction pattern defines a new edge of type CO_AUTHOR between the two entities.

        Parameters:
        temporalGdlQuery - A Temporal-GDL query as String
        constructionPattern - Construction pattern in Temporal-GDL format
        graphStatistics - Statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing the output of the construct pattern

      • temporalQuery

        default TemporalGraphCollection temporalQuery(String temporalGdlQuery,
                                              String constructionPattern,
                                              boolean attachData,
                                              MatchStrategy vertexStrategy,
                                              MatchStrategy edgeStrategy,
                                              TemporalGraphStatistics stats)
        Evaluates the given query using the Temporal-GDL query engine.
        Parameters:
        temporalGdlQuery - A Temporal-GDL query as String
        constructionPattern - Construction pattern in Temporal-GDL format
        attachData - attach original vertex and edge data to the result
        vertexStrategy - morphism setting for vertex mapping
        edgeStrategy - morphism setting for edge mapping
        stats - statistics about the data graph
        Returns:
        graph collection containing the output of the construct pattern or a graph collection containing matching subgraphs if the construction pattern is null.

      • toLogicalGraph

        LogicalGraph toLogicalGraph()
        Converts the TemporalGraph to a LogicalGraph instance by discarding all temporal information from the graph elements. All Ids (graphs, vertices, edges) are kept during the transformation.
        Returns:
        the logical graph instance

      • updateEdgeValidity

        default TemporalGraph updateEdgeValidity()
        Updates edges of this graph to set their validity such that an edge is only valid if both of its adjacent vertices are valid at that time. Edges that can never be valid since the validity of both vertices does not overlap, are discarded.

        Note that this will also remove dangling edges, in the same way BaseGraphOperators.verify() would.

        Returns:
        This graph with invalid or dangling edges removed.
